elements.name: finalizeAssetPlaceholder
elements.title: What is the value for the following items on the date of {deceasedName}'s death?

elements.name: question429
elements.title: P9 swearing date? Option to leave completely/partially blank so the applicant can swear the P9 at the courthouse.

elements.name: question435
elements.title: * [TYLER] fees if they want additional court certified copies of the estate grant - but this might not be an issue because they accepted copies rather than originals

elements.name: question453
elements.title: If you have not been able to obtain the exact amounts for certain assets or liabilities, you will first need to get an Authorization to Obtain Estate Information (P18). Some parties will accept a photocopy of this document while others may required certified copies. Each certified copy costs $40. Similarly, certified copies of the Estate Grant (P19) cost $40 each and may be required by some asset holders when transferring the assets over to you, the personal representative.

elements.name: question443
elements.title: Nov 24 2020 - Rush applications can be done by just a letter. (from Dani and Kristen). This is easy to enable. However, question going forward for DDRs is protocol for reading and/or responding to these letters. Can we allow SRLs to write the letters and say there is no guarantee nor a response expected; they just get what they get due to volume.

elements.name: PrintCertifiedCopies
elements.title: How many certified copies of the Representation Grant do you need?
elements.description: $40 each so call ahead to see if they will accept a photo copy instead of a certified court copy.
